name: unattenuated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not reduced or made weaker: People were shocked at the unattenuated severity of the sentences given by the judge that day. The researchers inoculated the mice with a live, unattenuated, meningitis virus.
More examplesFewer examplesThe expression of their unattenuated racism on the stage caused widespread anger.Unattenuated white light, originating from a 100-W halogen lamp, was focused on the specimen under the the microscope.No one would contemplate inoculating a subject with a live, unattenuated virus.This world-view was based on a largely unattenuated antipathy towards liberal and socialist values.
